key_points: Vice President Kamala Harris announces collaborative initiatives with France on space and cybersecurity following her meeting with President Emmanuel Macron.
The initiatives highlight the U.S. commitment to work with allies on 21st-century challenges, including space sustainability and cybersecurity.
U.S. and France to enhance cooperation in civil, commercial, and national security sectors of space.
The two countries aim to address global issues such as climate crisis, space exploration, STEM education, space environment sustainability, and space economy.
Initiatives include a comprehensive dialogue on space with participation from various U.S. and French departments and agencies.
The United States commits to joining the Space Climate Observatory (SCO) to make space data accessible for climate crisis mitigation and response.
The U.S. expresses commitment to working with allies on cybersecurity and upholding global norms in cyberspace.
Vice President Harris announced U.S. support for the Paris Call for Trust and Security in Cyberspace to advance cybersecurity globally.
The support for the Paris Call aligns with the Biden-Harris Administration's priority on international cybersecurity engagement.
The U.S. aims to improve cybersecurity through various international partnerships, including actions against cybercrime and updates to NATO cyber policy.
